thread.title: Spicer: Trump’s Order Puts National Security Above Inconvenience
thread.title_full: Spicer: Trump’s Order Puts National Security Above Inconvenience

author: Jack Davis
title: Spicer: Trump’s Order Puts National Security Above Inconvenience
text:
Twitter Bares Fangs After Director Likens Ivanka Trump To A Dog 
Because the rollout of the order created some issues, Spicer said the administration is “working through all the diplomatic channels necessary” to explain the order. 
Spicer also noted that the seven countries singled out by Trump were already labeled by the Obama administration as “countries of particular concern.” 
“The Obama administration put these first and foremost,” Spicer told ABC, adding that most Muslim nations are not touched. 
“There’s 46 Muslim-majority countries that are not in this seven,” he said. 
Spicer noted that security is the uppermost issue. 
“We’re going to say we’re going to make sure that we don’t let someone slip through the cracks who seeks to do our country harm. That’s it. … I know that in some cases there’s going to be a bit of an inconvenience,” he said. 
White House counselor Kellyanne Conway on Sunday said that at a time when America is under threat of attack from ISIS, precautions are necessary. 
“I was stopped many times – weren’t you? – after 9/11. I didn’t resemble or share a name with or be part of any kind of terrorist conspiracy. But this is what we do to keep a nation safe,” she said on Fox News Sunday . 
” I mean, there are — this whole idea that they’re being separated and ripped from their families — it’s temporary,”Conway added. “And it’s just circumstantial in terms of whether you’re one of those 300 and some who was already on an aircraft or trying to get an aircraft, as opposed to the over 3,000 children who will be forevermore separated from the parents who perished on 9/11.” What do you think?
